journals.notes: Note this might be related to the MSG_WriteBits issue that has been fixed in master already.

Spyhawk wrote:
> Note this might be related to the MSG_WriteBits issue that has been fixed in master already.

Not sure about this. Basically the given error message tells us we are out of memory in Z - allocating memory fails. We did fix tons of leaks and I think we should update our server to master. Let's use latest code ...
Sever had been updated. Let's see if it crashes again.

A file descriptor for etl.db  seems to be created on each map load, without closing the previous. (see attachment)
So maybe the system has reached a limit as the errno 24 on mapvoteinfo.txt suggest.


EDIT: sorry wanted to answer to #1243

Had similar crash today. 

Players: 40 appx
ETL Server: Current release
Mod: silent mod
Map: ET Beach 

Error before crash - 
Z_Malloc: failed on allocation of 33856 bytes from the main zone.

Are you using official 2.76 build, or making one yourself from the master?
But thanks for the report, these issues being slowly investigated.

ryven wrote:
> Are you using official 2.76 build, or making one yourself from the master?
> But thanks for the report, these issues being slowly investigated.

2.76 build. All our ETL servers (Windows + Linux) are on official 2.76 build as of now.

subject: Server crash
description:
Server randomly crashes after being left alone for a few days (etlegacy.com). This happened a couple of time already.
